story:
The Story

After Lincoln's assassination, very soon after, the government and the press conspired to tie up the loose strings surrounding the guilty, declare the case neatly solved and the villains all executed.

Nearly 40 years after the official version of the death of Lincoln's assassin, an alternate history emerged! A man claiming to be John Wilkes Booth made a deathbed confession. The "Curse of Booth" tells that story. Part mystery, part adventure, part romance. But is it the Truth?

This is the story of the handsome, acclaimed young actor John Wilkes Booth; loved by many woman, living in high society. What could have led him to throw his glamorous life away and commit  his horrendous crime? Who was really behind it. Someone else was shot in the barn! How did he escape ..... no one could kill him. He outlived everyone and died by his own hand in 1903.

But is it the truth?

The Impact

The story, as we tell it, is inspired by the 1908 book by Finis Bates and there is evidence, even beyond what we present. There is the agreement among the descendants of the large Booth family and of descendants of John Wilkes himself.

What we present exposes as mythology what passes for history and topples idols from their enshrined pedestals.

What We Need

We work-shopped at Tisch. We showcased at The Player's Club. Thanks to the response we're creating the multimedia show.

The medium and the message fit perfectly. The action takes place between the time Booth completes his will and his suicide. Booth reviews his life and the audience shares his experience  through projections that emerge on stage as they flash through his mind.

I am  as inspired by the artistic challenge of mixing of live performer and projections as I have been by the subject matter, the script and actors. We need YOUR help to bring this next phase to fruition.

We're looking to raise $40,000 All funds raised here will go toward filming, editing, and creating a fully mobile stage production that can be mounted in any theater.

What Else?

Please help us get the message out there! Visit our Facebook page and pass along our Indiegogo campaign and get the word out about this exciting, moving and mind-challenging play!

Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/The-Curse-of-Booth-621...
story_txt:
The Story
After Lincoln's assassination, very soon after, the government and the press conspired to tie up the loose strings surrounding the guilty, declare the case neatly solved and the villains all executed.
Nearly 40 years after the official version of the death of Lincoln's assassin, an alternate history emerged! A man claiming to be John Wilkes Booth made a deathbed confession. The "Curse of Booth" tells that story. Part mystery, part adventure, part romance. But is it the Truth?
This is the story of the handsome, acclaimed young actor John Wilkes Booth; loved by many woman, living in high society. What could have led him to throw his glamorous life away and commit  his horrendous crime? Who was really behind it. Someone else was shot in the barn! How did he escape ..... no one could kill him. He outlived everyone and died by his own hand in 1903.
But is it the truth?

The Impact
The story, as we tell it, is inspired by the 1908 book by Finis Bates and there is evidence, even beyond what we present. There is the agreement among the descendants of the large Booth family and of descendants of John Wilkes himself.
What we present exposes as mythology what passes for history and topples idols from their enshrined pedestals.
What We Need
We work-shopped at Tisch. We showcased at The Player's Club. Thanks to the response we're creating the multimedia show.
The medium and the message fit perfectly. The action takes place between the time Booth completes his will and his suicide. Booth reviews his life and the audience shares his experience  through projections that emerge on stage as they flash through his mind.
I am  as inspired by the artistic challenge of mixing of live performer and projections as I have been by the subject matter, the script and actors. We need YOUR help to bring this next phase to fruition.
We're looking to raise $40,000 All funds raised here will go toward filming, editing, and creating a fully mobile stage production that can be mounted in any theater.

What Else?
Please help us get the message out there! Visit our Facebook page and pass along our Indiegogo campaign and get the word out about this exciting, moving and mind-challenging play!
Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/The-Curse-of-Booth-621...

story:
Brighton Shakespeare Company

I am Mark Brailsford, the artistic director and founder of the company, a successful and professional director and producer of shows for over twenty years (The award winning Treason Show being the main production since 2000) but the BSC is not a one man band. I am fortunate to have an incredibly talented and dedicated team to work with and we have the knowledge, experience and talent at our disposal to create magical, well loved productions. Last year we had an enormous success with The Merry Wives of Windsor at BOAT (Brighton Open Air Theatre) and this year with Much Ado About Nothing which also toured to places such as Lewes Castle. Our expansion is based upon hugely appreciative audiences who love our work, comparing us favourably with The Globe in London. In short, we know that performing Macbeth in churches in November will be a spine tingling and thrilling project which we'd love to share with you.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to cover so many set up costs for the production, such as: Props, costume (vital!) marketing the show and essentials such as insurance cover. As we are an unfunded company we rely on box office and crowd funding to get this production to happen. You are essential. We are also rolling this out to schools as Macbeth is on the curriculum, so there is a community benefit too. This amount of £2750 is a third of what we need and is formulated on our previous successful crowdfunded campaign for Much Ado About Nothing where we successfully raised the sums required via Kickstarter. We moved to Indiegogo as they were better at transferring amounts and have more attractive terms.

With our theatre touring programme, you get to be part of the excitement not only of making a theatre production work, but one that will thrill and be talked about for years. Opening night party invitations, signed programmes and free tickets are part of the perks. Furthermore we are offering something else, the option to become a friend of the company. This means three things. 1) Invitations to exclusive first nights and last, including the parties. 2) Preferential booking for all future productions including discounted tickets 3) The opportunity to work with us on future productions, whether as a volunteer or even in the show. Alternatively you may wish to Sponsor the show and that will bring you prominence in website, print and social media advertising.

The Impact

Having created two highly successful shows in the traditional Shakespeare summer season with reviews such as "fantastic performances", "hilarious" and "the first time I have actually enjoyed Shakespeare", we now want to expand to create an autumn season with a difference; using wonderful ancient churches as venues.  This means we can bring Shakespeare to a new audience as well as make use of the incredible atmosphere and beauty of the churches. Brighton Shakespeare Company will also be working with schools which is proving incredibly popular as we have already filled workshops and matinee performances aimed specifically at schools in Brighton, Hove and Sussex, allowing them to see a quality show and work with the professionals involved locally. Indeed the feedback really has shown that quality work of this nature is desired locally, as one audience member of our last production of Much Ado About Nothing stated "Please do more of this, it will save me a fortune if I don't have to go to London all the time to see Shakespeare done well!"

Risks & Challenges

As well as being a joy, bringing work to churches also has its challenges (part of the reason we need your support). We need to work in an environment that is not set up for theatrical performance and so that requires creative thinking as well as money to ensure that a quality show is produced in particular with regards to elements such as performance space, lighting and sound. As the company and its members have touring experience, setting up productions in places as basic as a field and as exotic as a castle this is something we feel we can embrace and in the end make a virtue of.

As we are going out to churches in a variety of locations some of which are new to us, there is the risk element of ensuring a sizeable audience. Again that is something that support will help as whilst we are already making use of the website and social media to advertise, we will also be using print marketing such as posters and flyers to reach the audiences in their locality as well advertising the show in local newspapers.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone has money to spare, but you can still help. Please share the campaign far and wide so we make sure we reach as many people as possible. Thanks to you all, Brighton Shakespeare Company.

story:
WAKKA WAKKA

is an extravagantly creative, award-winning puppet troupe.  Our mission is to push the boundaries of the imagination by creating works that are bold, unique and unpredictable. 

Since 2001 we have created and produced eight original works of theatre which have toured extensively throughout the US and abroad.  All of Wakka Wakka’s productions have been highly physical, overlapping in a wide range of styles, including grotesque, absurd and clown, incorporating elements such as object manipulation, puppetry, masks and original music.

 

MADE IN CHINA

will open at 59E59 Theaters this January and run for six weeks at the venerable Off-Broadway institution.  This show is our first full puppet musical, and our most ambitious project to date.  We have been blessed to receive substantial grant funding for the project, however we have another $10,000 to raise to complete our production budget.

 

YOUR SUPPORT

will allow us to present a piece of innovative visual theater is artistically rigorous, entertaining and thought-provoking without having to compromise due to financial constraints.  Wakka is upping our game with MADE IN CHINA.  This show has the largest cast we've ever had, and we will be collaborating with more outside artists and designers than ever before.  Simply put, we're going to make the biggest, best show we've ever made, and your funds will directly help to increase the quality of our work.

 

THE PERKS

are awesome.  Tickets, cast parties, recordings, tote bags and more!

 

WHY

help us?  Our work is worth it.  This show is worth it.  Our unique style of high quality, innovative visual theater examines global issues through a personal lense.  We tell stories that resonate deeply on the individual level while examining universal themes.   And we tell those stories with puppets.  And comedy.  And in this case, songs!

story:
Who is The Callback Company? 

We were created by industry and academic professionals to provide specialized audition preparation and training in music, acting, and dance while offering exposure to working professionals and opportunities to perform in local and national auditions and showcases. We also teach you how to keep current in marketing trends! The Callback Company develops individual experiences for each member based on their own unique skills while identifying and strengthening their weaknesses.We have the expertise to help you make the right choices and to prepare those choices for your success! We have contacts in the industry who need to see what YOU have to offer. We want to prepare you for the musical theatre life, which means AUDITIONS!!! We want to help you achieve your goal through stellar auditions- whether it be for your dream college program or your dream role. 

 

Check us out: www.callbackcompany.com 

 

We have had the amazing privilege of providing some amazing opportunities with some of the best in the business shown below since our debut in November 2015:

Shuler Hensley (Tony award winning actor)

Georgia Stitt (Broadway Composer and wife of Jason Robert Brown)

Arbender Robinson (Shuffle Along, The Lion King, Hairspray, Hair; Broadway current)

Jared Bradshaw (Jersey Boys, Broadway; current)

Lindsay Northen (Wicked, Broadway; current)

Alison Franck (NYC Casting Director)

Robert Vest (Voice Faculty at AMDA; NYC)

D. Scott Ferguson (Broadway, Composer, Musical Director of National Tours)

Richard Garner (Atlanta based Director and founder of GA Shakes)

Devon Hales (The Light in the Piazza, Theatrical Outfit; Atlanta)

Boe Wank (Dance Captain for the National Tour of Anything Goes)

Lana Neuman (AMDA, Warner Bros.)

Whitney Winfield (Fiona in the National Tour of Shrek)

 

The Impact

With this campaign, we are looking to help fund the following: 

-Non-Profit: We would like to procure funds to establish a non-profit arm for The Callback Company. This will help us with community outreach programs and scholarships for students. 

-Programming: The Callback Company would like to continue bringing in quality talent to be utilized for substantial educational opportunities. 

-Marketing: Advertising, print marketing, social media and material distributions are all necessary to keep the community informed on all of our upcoming events. Marketing is extremely important to continue to the drive of community outreach. 

-Operations: As our memberships continue to grow, there are many financial needs associated with the day to day processes of running a business. These include, but are not limited to: website hosting, legal, tax and insurance fees, venue and travel costs and conference exhibitor fees. 

-Home Base: The Callback Company was established as an internet based company that travels wherever needs need to be met. We plan to continue to travel to any areas that show interest in our services, but we would really love to establish a home base. That means finding a space to call our own where we can coach, host masterclasses and seminars and have performances. 

Risks & Challenges

There are so many fantastic arts programs and studios sprouting up all across Georgia. This growth is encouraging and we are excited to see the passion for the arts grow. Our endeavors are different, however. We do not focus on or produce performances. We strictly focus on the art of auditioning. The "job" of any musical theatre/theatre performer is to audition. Our goal is to reinforce the training these students are already receiving from their high schools and college programs by providing individualized audition training to meet their specific needs. This specialized audition training prepares young people not only for opportunities on the stage, but for real life situations where confidence and good communication skills will lead to their success. You only get one first impression. Whether that is in the audition room or a job interview- your success comes down to confidence and preparation. Clients of The Callback Company accomplish both. 

Other Ways You Can Help

While the purpose of this campaign is to spear head a fundraising effort, the most important objective is to raise awareness for The Callback Company and the educational services we provide. Here are some ways you can contribute: 

-Spread the news! Like us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter and Instagram and share our publicity through social media and personal email. Word of mouth is extremely important.

-Sponsor student memberships and/or individual fees towards al a carte events. 

-Sponsor an event! Whether it be a Cabaret or a Broadway/Professional Masterclass, we are always looking for partnerships to further our educational programs. 

-Invite us to your arts community or school! We are always willing to team up with other arts programs to provide heightened theatre experiences. 

-Consider matching the funds we already raise through this campaign. 

To contact us about getting involved email us at: contact@callbackcompany.com 

What folks are saying: 

Boe Wank (NYC) Dance captain; Anything Goes, National Tour: 
"The Callback Company is so important because not everyone gets the opportunities a showcase or master classes can give you. Exposure to life outside of a university wall and to one of the world's most competitive markets is priceless, and I am so happy to see a company that brings the industry to the students and the students to the city.  I think the Callback Company is on its way to becoming a major asset to students who want to push themselves beyond the opportunities they are given. It's the same hunger you possess to choose theatre in the first place, and it's the same drive that will get you to pound the pavement and keep waking up every day to more and more chances to make your dreams real. It all boils down to passion, preparation, and work. "

 

Mary Brehl (Parent of a Callback Company member)

"The Callback Company has done wonders to boost my daughters confidence as she prepares to participate in high school productions. As a rising 9th grader, she has grown more over the last several months under the direction and guidance of this program than she has in the last 3 years participating in various musicals and productions. They really help students polish their talent so that they are presenting the best version of themselves in an audition situation."

 

Christian Gates (College Student) 

"After spending this weekend with this amazing company all I want to do is spend another weekend here. I learned so much in such a short amount of time and my confidence in myself has definitely been boosted. For the first time in a long time, thanks to this company, I finally feel like I have what it takes. Thank you Callback Company for the amazing experience."

 

read more about us at: www.callbackcompany.com

story:
My name is Tara Cassone.  I am the owner of La Vita Bella Dance Studio in Guanajuato, Mexico. I have been dancing my whole life. I majored in dance in high school and college. I have been trained by champions from around the word and am certified with high honors in 4 different ballroom styles. I have competed in and won numerous competitions as an amateur and a professional over the span of 16 years. Long story short, dancing is my life. 

7 years ago, I moved from Minnesota to Mexico, and 3 years ago teaching dance became my life. I am equally as passionate about teaching as I am about dancing. In particular, teaching young people and knowing that they have everything it takes to become champions.

Last October, after only 6 months of training Arturo (age 22) and Andrea (age 10), became State Champions, placing higher than people with years of experience, and in Andrea's case, people who were twice her age. Arturo went on to win two National Competitions in the following months.

After 7 months of training, Belen (age 26) and Fernando (age 22) were National Semi-Finalists, and received many positive comments on their dancing from teachers and professionals.

The only difference between my students and me is opportunity.

With $10,000, I will be able dedicate a sufficient amount of time to their training to accelerate their advancement. I will help them attain visas and passports and cover travel expenses, giving them more opportunities to compete in Mexico and internationally.

All of my students have told me in their own words how much dancing has improved and changed their lives. But there are many things they can't say, things I see expressed on their faces or in their bodies. I see their confidence and self-worth grow with every step, I see how happy and fulfilled they are when they finish class. These intangible, precious moments are some of the most valuable experiences I have had. Your donation will allow these young people to continue to follow their dreams and surpass their own expectations in dancing and in life. 

ANY size donation is accepted. Your kindness is received with gratitude and love and a commitment to quality of dancing and quality of life. Please share this project with your friends and family!

Follow us on facebook to track progress of the campaign and see pictures and videos of the La Vita Bella Team reaching their goals!
